eu.fbk.dkm.springles.base

Class UpdateSpec

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.fbk.dkm.springles.base.UpdateSpec
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public final class UpdateSpec
extends Object
implements Serializable
    An update operation specification.

    This class models the specification of an update operation, combining in a single object both a language-specific string representation (e.g., SPARQL) and the Sesame algebraic representation:

    • the string representation is encoded through properties getString(), getLanguage() and getBaseURI(), the latter being the optional URI used to interpret relative URIs in the update string;
    • the algebraic representation is encoded through properties getExpressions(), getDatasets() and getNamespaces(); an update operation is a sequence of statements each having its expression and dataset, which share the same namespace declarations.

    An UpdateSpec can be created in two ways: either providing its string representation (methods from(String) and from(String, QueryLanguage, String)); or providing its algebraic representation (methods from(Iterable, Iterable) and from(Iterable, Iterable, Map)). In both case, the dual representation is automatically derived, either via parsing or rendering to SPARQL language:

    • automatic parsing is supported only for QueryLanguages for which a parser is available in Sesame: if it is not the case, property isParsed() will be set to false, the algebraic representation will not be computed and accessing the corresponding three properties will result in an error;
    • automatic rendering of an algebraic expression to a corresponding SPARQL string is always possible; when this happens, property isRendered() is set to true.

    UpdateSpec objects are created through the from factory methods which provide for the caching and reuse of already created expression, thus reducing parsing overhead. Serialization is supported, with deserialization attempting to reuse existing objects from the cache. Instances have to considered to be immutable: while it is not possible to (efficiently) forbid modifying the update expressions (getExpressions()), ALGEBRAIC EXPRESSIONS MUST NOT BE MODIFIED, as this will interfer with caching.

    See Also:

      The base URI for interpreting relative URIs in the update string, possibly null.

      The parsed datasets for the update operation; null if it cannot be parsed.

      The parsed algebraic expressions for the update operation; null if it cannot be parsed.

      The language the update string is expressed in.

      The parsed namespaces for the update operation; null if it cannot be parsed.

      Flag that is true if the update string was rendered.

      • from

        public static UpdateSpec from(String string)
                       throws org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException
        Returns an UpdateSpec for the specified SPARQL update string. This is a convenience method corresponding to from(string, QueryLanguage.SPARQL, null).
        Parameters:
        string - the update string, in SPARQL and without relative URIs
        Returns:
        the corresponding UpdateSpec
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.query.MalformedQueryException - in case the string has syntax errors

        baseURI - the base URI to interpret relative URIs in the string

      • from

        public static UpdateSpec from(Iterable<org.openrdf.query.algebra.UpdateExpr> expressions,
              Iterable<org.openrdf.query.Dataset> datasets)
        Returns an UpdateSpec for the algebraic expressions and corresponding datasets specified. This is a convenience methods corresponding to from(expressions, datasets, Collections.emptyMap()).
        Parameters:
        expressions - the algebraic expressions for the statements of the update operation
        datasets - the datasets corresponding to the algebraic expressions (must have the same size)
        Returns:
        the corresponding UpdateSpec

      • checkParsed

        Helper method that throws an UnsupportedOperationException if the algebraic representation is not available.

      • getString

        public String getString()
        Returns the update string. The returned string is expressed in language getLanguage() and possibly automatically rendered (isRendered() true) from a supplied algebraic expression.
        Returns:
        the update string

      • getLanguage

        public org.openrdf.query.QueryLanguage getLanguage()
        Returns the language the update string is expressed in. If the string has been automatically rendered from a supplied algebraic expression, the language is QueryLanguage.SPARQL.
        Returns:
        the language

      • getBaseURI

        @Nullable
public String getBaseURI()
        Returns the optional base URI to be used to interpret relative URIs in the update string. The base URI can be null, in which case it is assumed that the update string does not contain relative URIs.
        Returns:
        the base URI, possibly null

      • isRendered

        public boolean isRendered()
        Returns true if the update string has been rendered starting from a supplied algebraic expression.
        Returns:
        true if the update string has been rendered

      • isParsed

        public boolean isParsed()
        Returns true if the algebraic representation of the update operation is available. This representation may be unavailable in case an update string has been supplied, whose language has not an associated Sesame parser.
        Returns:
        true if the algebraic representation is available

      • getExpressions

        public List<org.openrdf.query.algebra.UpdateExpr> getExpressions()
                                                          throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Returns the algebraic expressions for the operations of the update operation - DON'T MODIFY THE RESULT. As expressions must be cached for performance reasons, modifying them would affect all subsequent operations reusing the same expressions, so CLONE THE EXPRESSIONS BEFORE MODIFYING THEM.
        Returns:
        the algebraic expressions for this update operation
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - in case the algebraic representation is unavailable

      • getDatasets

                                            throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Returns the datasets associated to the statements of the update operation.
        Returns:
        the datasets
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - in case the algebraic representation is unavailable

      • getNamespaces

        public Map<String,String> getNamespaces()
                                 throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Returns the namespace declarations for the update operation.
        Returns:
        a map of prefix -> namespace declarations
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - in case the algebraic representation is unavailable

      • explode

        public List<UpdateSpec> explode()
                         throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Splits a compound update operation into a list of atomic (single-statements) operations.
        Returns:
        a list of update operations, one for each update statement in this operation
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - in case the algebraic representation is unavailable

      • enforceDataset

                          throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Returns an UpdateSpec with the same statements of this specification, all being associated to the dataset specified.
        Parameters:
        dataset - the dataset to be enforced, null to associate to an unspecified dataset
        Returns:
        the resulting UpdateSpec object (possibly this if no change is required)
        Throws:
        UnsupportedOperationException - in case the algebraic representation of this is unavailable
